website_summaries.verdict: The best option to connect any compatible USB-C device. Can be used for charging and syncing files like photos and music.
pros: A fast data transfer rate of 10Gbps will make file transfers quick and easy
Extra cord shielding to keep interference from outside sources down to a minimum
cons: The 3 ft. cord length might be too short for some computer setups

customer_reviews.title: DOES work with iPad Pro 2018
customer_reviews.text: Expensive cable, but DOES work with iPad Pro 2018, for charging and connecting to desktop for backing up and restoring via iTunes. Belkin chat didn't know whether it works or not? They said the iPad Pro 2018 was a new device and they hadn't tested it yet, but it DOES work.
customer_reviews.author: Robby69

customer_reviews.title: Used this to load videos onto new iPad Pro 11 inch
customer_reviews.text: This cable was required to load my videos and movies from PC computer onto the new iPad Pro 11 inch. Apple does not provide it in the box.
customer_reviews.author: Zacharia

customer_reviews.title: Bought after getting cheaper cables only to find those didn't ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought after getting cheaper cables only to find those didn't work with Pixel 2 and Android auto. This cable so far is flawless.
customer_reviews.author: D. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with all USB-A type devices
customer_reviews.text: The BELKIN F2CU029bt1M-BLK 3.1 USB-A to USB-C Cable does not work with all USB-A type devices... Using this cable between a USB-C laptop and a USB 3 hard drive enclosure does not work with many enclosures as the resistor selection wires (which control current draw limits) are not in the older USB-A plug/cable standard -- so the drive enclosure can't select the USB-C current draw. This cable would work as a USB-C to/from USB-A data cable only, but not to supply power across the cable.
customer_reviews.author: Dachshund Owner

customer_reviews.title: didn't work for connecting Thunderbolt 3 of new MacBookPro to Thunderbolt 2 desktop
customer_reviews.text: Be sure this is what you need. Advised to buy this by Apple tech support. When it didn't work, they said, "Oh, gee, you really need something else. We'll send the new thing to you for free." As a 70 year old who is getting tired of playing catch-up on every new device, I feel frustrated that they don't make it more clear what these connectors are good for. It probably works great for something. just not for connecting a 2019 Apple MacBook Pro to a late 2015 Apple 27-inch desktop.
customer_reviews.author: LindaR

customer_reviews.title: It's almost entirely worth it.
customer_reviews.text: My assessment of the durability may be a little unfair. I bought this as a replacement to one that I bought after my original S8+ charger stopped fast charging. It's lasted up to about a month ago. I suspect it got stepped on one too many times or wound up and too tightly and tossed in my suitcase. Maybe, probably both we'll see how much abuse this one takes. 5 hours and counting...
customer_reviews.author: J West

customer_reviews.title: 3.1 USB A to C Just works
customer_reviews.text: Hard to say if the cable is making a difference, but in my set-up, I haven't needed to deal with the cable nor the SSD it's bridging to a DAC. The DAC sees the SSD's files instantly. I dinged one star due to experience with hard plastic end-connections that have become brittle and cracked. It will take years to know how Belkin's plastic connections will hold-up under temperature in the semi-enclosed audio rack. The cable is somewhat stiff, but hopefully this is due to better shielding compared to thin/flexible. Seller: price swings? I paid more than it is now a couple months later.
customer_reviews.author: Avg Joe

customer_reviews.title: Delivers USB 3.1 Gen 2 transfer
customer_reviews.text: Actually delivers USB 3.1 Gen 2 transfer rate on my computer. I get same transfer rate with a Samsung T5 SSD that I got with short Samsung provided cable it replaced.
customer_reviews.author: DE

customer_reviews.title: Great for Android Auto and Samsung Dex use...
customer_reviews.text: Very thick, sturdy, and quality cable. Has the least amount of drops of all my other cables for Android Auto (I use like 5 or 6 cables, since Google wants to blame the cables for any AA issues). Also, flawless connection to my PC / Note 10+ phones for Samsung Dex.
customer_reviews.author: Roberto Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Solid as a rock, if a rock could keep you connected to Android Auto
customer_reviews.text: I first bought the "Google official Pixel 2 XL" cable. Lies, lies, lies. This was not a replacement cable, and would disconnect randomly. This Belkin cable was a bit more money than I wanted to dole out for a piece of wire, but I can't argue with the results. 100% connectivity with no drops.
customer_reviews.author: leathej1

customer_reviews.title: have a great day and I hope this review helps you in ...
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be a very heavy duty and durable cable. Transfer time and charge time seem to be more efficient and time saying be over the stock. I hope to remember to revisit this review for long-term usage and durability; have a great day and I hope this review helps you in your purchasing decision.
customer_reviews.author: John Y.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality Charging and Data Cable
customer_reviews.text: High quality cable from the top of the line computer peripherals cable maker, Belkin. Conforms to USB specifications and you can see and feel the quality. If your goinf to spend money on expensive devices like an Apple 12" MacBook don't skimp on cheap cables. Too many of the cheap cables don't meet USB specifications and they can pose a problem to your expensive equipment. When you hear the "pop" from a short in your cheap cable and your 12" MacBook Retina USB-C port stops working you'll regret those few dollars you thought you saved.
customer_reviews.author: Impedimentus

customer_reviews.title: Solid cable
customer_reviews.text: Solid cable capable of USB 3.1 Gen 2 speeds. I attached my external USB-C NVME drive with a USB-C - USB-A adapter just to test the speeds.. I got almost 8 Gbps (thats the limit of my external drive). I get the exact same speeds using a USB-C to USB-C cable. Im sure it can go higher (aka 10 Gbps)
customer_reviews.author: Pronob Ashwin

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: I was Apple would get the program and issue USB type cables. I am very pleased with this cable, great value for the price and performance.
customer_reviews.author: Zero

customer_reviews.title: Paid high price, didn't last!
customer_reviews.text: I thought If I paid the high price for this cord it would last better than a $10 model. I was wrong. 9 months and it quit working.
customer_reviews.author: CaptRic

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: This product was a great replacement for my original that was left in a hotel. Charges quickly and is very sturdy.

customer_reviews.title: Nice solid cable
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to order a longer one but that's my fault. It really is a quality cable. I can't ever see it failing.

customer_reviews.title: excellent value for the money
customer_reviews.text: These cables were used to connect to two external harddrives and transfer data. I got usb 3.0 speed. Very good product for the money.

customer_reviews.title: This material is thick and hard to bend and doesn't become the best option in the car
customer_reviews.text: Bought after trying other USB Type C cables that did not work in my Car for Android Auto. This works flawless, the only issue is the cable would have been made with Nylon. This material is thick and hard to bend and doesn't become the best option in the car.

customer_reviews.title: Not the speed promised
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this cable for the high speed that was promised. Didn't deliver.
customer_reviews.author: Gail Pellett

customer_reviews.title: Belkin is one of the very best
customer_reviews.text: Belkin is more expensive than no-name brands BUT worth it. Great quality. Saving a few bucks on a lesser brand won't serve you in the long run
customer_reviews.author: Glenn

customer_reviews.title: FIVE STARS
customer_reviews.text: one of the best reliable cable and most important very fast data transfer 1 GB file in 4 Seconds

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but meet USB C certification
customer_reviews.text: The cable is fast and works just as stated. Meets the USB C specification. The length is definitely good enough compare to the one that comes with my Nexus 6P. Price can be lower for sure its rather too expensive costing at least 3 times more than others similar cable. One thing is the USB C connector is rather long. Lost it somehow have tobuse back the stock one.

customer_reviews.text: New Ipad pro will not connect to Itunes on desktop with this cable.

customer_reviews.title: High quality cables.
customer_reviews.text: Love this, its easy to use; not too tight to take off the port, and feels really durable and robust.

customer_reviews.title: Does what it should, feels solid.
customer_reviews.text: Looks and feels pretty solid, good length, does what it needs to. I use this in conjunction with a power bank and occasional charging in the car. I have also tried data transfer from a phone to a computer, very quick.

customer_reviews.title: Probably one of the few high speed (3.1) certified usb-c cables that works 100% flawlessly.
customer_reviews.text: This one is probably one of the few high speed (3.1) usb-c cables out there that is certified and does not mess up your device. Still working great and going along fine.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great cable, and great seller (TalkAccessories) for my portable hard drive. Works perfectly!

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality
customer_reviews.text: Keeps saying slow charging, definitely not 3.1 if it can't fast charge. Amazon needs WAY BETTER QUALITY CONTROL!

customer_reviews.title: Workability
customer_reviews.text: I used the BELKIN F2CU029bt1M-BLK 3.1 USB-A to USB-C Cable only once, over six months ago. USB plastic covering came completely detached. Try to use yesterday and it didn’t even work. Waste of money.

customer_reviews.title: GREAT BUY! Well worth the $$$!!

product_meta.title: BELKIN F2CU029bt1M-BLK 3.1 USB-A to USB-C Cable, 3ft
product_meta.description: Product Packaging:Standard PackagingThe Belkin USB-A to USB-C Charge Cable lets you charge your USB-C device as well as sync your photos, music and data to your existing laptop. Experience up to 10 Gbps transfer rates, up to 20X faster than USB 2. 0 (480Mbps), 12x faster than FireWire 800, and 2X faster than USB 3. 0 (5Gbps). You will be amazed at the difference USB 3. 1 makes
feature_bullets: Connect USB-C enabled devices (new MacBook, Chromebook Pixel) with standard USB-A devices (laptops, hard drives, etc.)

Compatible with all current available USB-C built-in devices: Google Chromebook Pixel 2, Apple New MacBook, LeTV Smartphone, Kensington Digital USB USB-C Flash Drive, Nokia N1 Tablet, SanDisk Portable SSD USB C, SanDisk 32GB Flash Drive, OnePlus 2 Smartphone, HP Pavilion x2 2-in-1, HP Pro Tablet 608

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars289 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
